page.title: 19HOUSING- Roxby & Risby
page.content: The{small hamlet}of Risby lies between Roxby and Appleby comprising a pig farm and two farm cottages set well back from the road and nine pairs of farm cottages along the road, together with two large farm houses. Roxby is a mixture of the old and the new. The old being mainly 6 pairs of semi-detached cottages, circa 1820, one of which has been converted into a single dwelling. At the edge of the village is a farmhouse and out building circa 1900 and in the village itself, two large detached dwellings at least 200 years old. The new buildings have again infilled the gaps Scattered between Roxby and Appleby are 3 farms with farmhouses and 7 farm cottages, a large detached dwelling, a modern bungalow and the{Lodge Gate {House}the former Appleby home of the {Lord St Oswald,}which was burnt down.
